item.g:title: Ironica Chair: Ironically An Icon
item.g:description: The Ironica chair looks Scandinavian in style, yet we designed it ourselves in the Czech Republic. The thin seat and seven smooth bars in the backrest allow you to relax in comfort. The Ironica can also be both retro or fiercely modern and stylish. It fits in practically anywhere and looks great in pigment colours.

item.g:title: 811 Chair: Sophisticated Elegance
item.g:description: Good design never grows old. This model was first designed nearly 100 years ago by the Austrian Josef Hoffmann. He created a classic chair using bentwood, which is usually combined with a cane weave to ensure an extremely comfortable sitting experience.

item.g:title: 14 Chair: A Timeless Icon
item.g:description: The Number 14 chair was first made in 1859 and changed the perception of mass-produced furniture forever. Its elegant shape, lightness and strength, combined with an affordable price, have ensured its enduring popularity. More than 80 million pieces have been sold to date.

item.g:title: 18 Chair: A Café Icon
item.g:description: This other classic model, created in 1876, builds on the idea of the original café chair. The Number 18 is comparably light and elegant to the Number 14 chair, but has a vertically filled backrest to add strength and enhance comfort.

item.g:title: Dejavu Chair_378: Light Elegance
item.g:description: This very light, yet comfortable chair is made of bent beechwood and, despite its fragile appearance, the technology used guarantees strength and stability. First made in the late 19th century, the Déjà vu recalls the good old days.

item.g:title: Stand by 15 Coat Stand: Bentwood Beauty
item.g:description: Several types of bends come together in this typically Thonet coat-stand. A universal piece in our collection, it perfectly complements a wide variety of interiors. We use some of our smallest components when we make it.

item.g:title: Bergamo Chair: Simply stackable
item.g:description: This simple, angular chair, designed by Tom Kelley, is often seen in restaurants, where it is valued for providing a comfortable seat with a curved backrest. The Bergamo has many upholstery options and what’s more, it is stackable.

item.g:title: Bergamo Chair: Simply stackable
item.g:description: This simple, angular chair, designed by Tom Kelley, is often seen in restaurants, where it is valued for providing a comfortable seat with a curved backrest. The Bergamo has many upholstery options and what’s more, it is stackable.

item.g:title: Treviso Chair: Italian Stackability
item.g:description: The stackable, comfortable Treviso chair’s conservative look is unobtrusive, but will still catch your eye. Designed by Tom Kelley, the Treviso’s function follows its form, yet the chair is still imbued with Italian sparkle. The gently bent legs will fit into any interior, as will the numerous upholstery options.

item.g:title: Stockholm Chair: Scandinavian Purity
item.g:description: The severe lines of this stackable chair, designed by Scandinavian designer Mads K. Johansen, give it an interesting appearance. Despite the severity of its shape, the Stockholm chair is an unobtrusive and comfortable seat.

item.g:title: Stockholm Chair: Scandinavian Purity
item.g:description: The severe lines of this stackable chair, designed by Scandinavian designer Mads K. Johansen, give it an interesting appearance. Despite the severity of its shape, the Stockholm chair is an unobtrusive and comfortable seat.

item.g:title: Casablanca Lounge Armchair: Cubist Comfort
item.g:description: A low, comfortable armchair, with uninterrupted purity of line, called the Casablanca and designed by Tom Kelley. Its minimalist look makes it suitable for a wide range of interiors. A huge advantage of the Casablanca is that it can also be purchased in a two-seat version, to create an airy interior with cubist regularity.

item.g:title: 4 Chair: Lean On The Heart
item.g:description: The 4 Chair Collection is a timeless expression of sophistication. This classic design, with the distinctive heart-shaped detail in the backrest, testifies to the pinnacle of craftsmanship in our portfolio. This collection, primarily created using a challenging manual process, is one of our most technically demanding products.

item.g:title: Stockholm Barstool: Scandinavian Purity
item.g:description: The severe lines of this simple barstool, designed by Scandinavian designer Mads K. Johansen, give it an interesting appearance. Despite the severity of its shape, the Stockholm chair is an unobtrusive and comfortable seat, complemented by tiny, elegant details such as the precision connecting the seat and legs.

item.g:title: Petalo Coat Stand: Bentwood Handsome
item.g:description: The design of this silent servant was inspired by the shapes of petals, which the designer inserted into four bent beech rods. While it is intended to help you keep your room tidy, you’ll prefer to clear up immediately so you can display this beautiful piece by designer Eugenie Minerva instead.

item.g:title: 2 Chair: Minimalism At Its Best
item.g:description: The “Two” is a new take on the classic Number 14 chair. Designer Jaroslav Juřica has transformed the elegant model into a new shape consisting of only three pieces, two of which are identical. Minimalism has never looked better.

item.g:title: 2 Chair: Minimalism At Its Best
item.g:description: The “Two” is a new take on the classic Number 14 chair. Designer Jaroslav Juřica has transformed the elegant model into a new shape consisting of only three pieces, two of which are identical. Minimalism has never looked better.

item.g:title: Tee Coat Stand: Silent Strongman
item.g:description: A minimalist combination of a concrete pedestal and a wooden rod suitable for any interior where clothing needs to be hung up. Although far from our biggest product, it has multiple height levels to provide full functionality, meaning that Tee is accessible even for small children. Designed by Jan Padrnos.

item.g:title: Moritz Chair: Comfort Squared
item.g:description: It may look like a chair, but it’s as comfortable as an armchair! Designed by Austrian Kai Stania, the Moritz chair combines a conservative square shape with comfort, wrapped up in a luxurious appearance. The comfort is boosted by pocket springs and injected foam, allowing you to concentrate on other pleasures in life: eating, loving or relaxing.

item.g:title: Merano Chair: Modern Classic
item.g:description: The shape of this comfortable, stackable wooden chair combines woodbending heritage with strict modernism. Designed by Austrian designer Alexander Gufler, it is the best-selling model in our modern history – and our most copied model too.

item.g:description: The tallest member of the Merano family, the Merano barstool’s shape combines woodbending heritage with strict modernism. Designed by Austrian designer Alexander Gufler, it is the best-selling model in our modern history – and our most copied model too.

item.g:description: The tallest member of the Merano family, the Merano barstool’s shape combines woodbending heritage with strict modernism. Designed by Austrian designer Alexander Gufler, it is the best-selling model in our modern history – and our most copied model too.

item.g:title: Dowel Armchair: On Cloud Nine
item.g:description: You can see at first glance that the Dowel lounge chair is comfortable as hell. The soft, striking upholstery catches your eye and emphasises the curved wood. The Dowel can be used in lobbies, chill-out zones and cafés, but also works perfectly as a standalone conversation piece in your interior. Designed by British designers from Lime Studio.

item.g:title: Delta Table 722: Minimalist Dream
item.g:description: The Delta table, designed by Austrian Kai Stania, is both elegant and practical. The minimalist design and solid wood will fit perfectly in an office or at home, while the slender legs will not get in the way of comfortable seating. Delta coffee tables will meet anyone’s requirements for their space.

item.g:title: Stelvio Table: Italian Dining
item.g:description: Our biggest table is inspired by the Italian pass Stelvio and was designed by Alexander Gufler. The spacious tabletop is suitable for Italian-style long dinners, or for office work, because a drawer nest can be added in the centre. The minimalist look is completed by solid wood legs, rounded edges and timeless design.

item.g:title: Split Chair: Perfection Of A Split
item.g:description: We were the first in the world to split the wood holding the comfortable seat. The unique Split chair, designed by Arik Levy, elevates ordinary seating into something extraordinary.

item.g:title: Leaf Chair: Surprising Lightness
item.g:description: This chair’s bend plywood seat echoes the shape of a leaf. It creates visual lightness despite the hard wood used in the structure. This unique combination was designed by the Italian studio e-ggs.

item.g:title: Leaf Table 442: Surprising Lightness
item.g:description: Lightness and airiness are significant characteristics of the Leaf family, designed by the Italian studio E-ggs. The Leaf table also creates an airy impression, despite being made from solid wood. Our precise handcrafting puts the finishing touch to the pure experience of sitting at it.

item.g:title: Merano Trolley: Rolling Friend
item.g:description: Whenever you need to move Merano chairs, use this beechwood trolley! It can hold up to 11 upholstered or 14 plain chairs, stacked one on top of the other. The trolley is designed to pass through doors with a minimum width of 60 cm.

item.g:title: Albu Chair: Cozy Nest
item.g:description: You won’t want to get out of the Albu chair, because its unique pocket spring system makes it lovely to sit in. This chair will add a very pleasant touch to a work meeting, a moment at home with a book or a café catch-up with friends. Designed by Alexander Gufler.

item.g:title: Albu Armchair: Wide Cozy Nest
item.g:description: You won’t want to get out of the Albu armchair, because its unique pocket spring system makes it lovely to sit in. This chair will add a very pleasant touch to a work meeting, a moment at home with a book or a café catch-up with friends. Designed by Alexander Gufler.

item.g:title: Albu Lounge Armchair: Snug Cozy Nest
item.g:description: You won’t want to get out of the Albu lounge chair, because its unique pocket spring system makes it lovely to sit in. This chair will add a very pleasant touch to a work meeting, a moment at home with a book or a café catch-up with friends. Designed by Alexander Gufler.

item.g:title: Lasu Table: Stackable Pioneer
item.g:description: Clean shapes and a variety of finishes make this table suitable for many settings; the pioneering designer was Alexander Gufler. The Lasu table is stackable and the tables can also be connected and combined to form bigger units for use in dining halls, conference rooms and offices.

item.g:title: Lasu Table: Stackable Pioneer
item.g:description: Clean shapes and a variety of finishes make this table suitable for many settings; the pioneering designer was Alexander Gufler. item.g:title: Fleur Coat Hook: Stable Friend
item.g:description: The Fleur, a simple coat-stand, was entirely inspired by traditional manual woodbending processes. Three pieces of beechwood form a stable hanger for every item of clothing you need to hang up. Looks great in pigment. By Slovak designer Lubo Majer.

item.g:title: Ironica Barstool: Ironically Tall Icon
item.g:description: The Ironica barstool looks Scandinavian in style, yet we designed it ourselves in the Czech Republic. The thin seat and seven smooth bars in the backrest allow you to relax in comfort. The Ironica can also be both retro or fiercely modern and stylish. It fits in practically anywhere and looks great in pigment colours.

item.g:title: Dowel Two-seater: On Cloud Nine

The Dowel can be used in lobbies, chill-out zones and cafés, but also works perfectly as a standalone conversation piece in your interior. Designed by British designers from Lime Studio.

item.g:title: Ink_44 Table: Back To The Roots
item.g:description: Striking in its natural finish, the Ink table stands out from the rest with its eye-catching triangular legs extending naturally from the corners. This absolute classic can be paired with our oldest iconic models as well as the most recent. Designed by Michal Riabič.

item.g:title: Chips Lounge Chair: Poetic Presence
item.g:description: The Chips lounge armchair, by Czech designer Lucie Koldová, will take pride of place in a stylish interior, which it can also match with a wide range of colours. Chips will transform an ordinary room into a lavish mansion because it combines armchair and design object in one.

item.g:title: Chips Ottoman: Poetic Extention
item.g:description: Every master has a servant. This ottoman works best with the Chips chair, but it can also be used separately, or as a footstool. Designed by Lucie Koldová.

item.g:title: Valencia Chair: Epitome of Comfort
item.g:description: This chair is astonishing. It is designed with an unusually wide backrest, giving the classic chair a twist, but also ensuring that sitting comfort is second to none. And it’s stackable, so ticks all the boxes! Designed by Spanish studio Yonoh.

item.g:title: Ginger Armchair: Snug Elegance
item.g:description: Comfort, luxury and elegance are the hallmarks of the Ginger lounge chair, designed by Spanish studio Yonoh. Its rounded shapes and elaborate upholstery enhance sitting comfort. This chair’s shape makes it suitable for spacious interiors, both classic and modern.

item.g:title: 811 Barstool: Sophisticated elegance
item.g:description: Good design never grows old. This model was first designed by the Austrian Josef Hoffmann, nearly 100 years ago. He made an elegant chair with a bentwood backrest, which is usually combined with a cane weave to ensure an extremely comfortable sitting position.

item.g:title: YYY Table 421: Playful Triple
item.g:description: Three heights, three diameters, and three good reasons to play with this design. When viewed from below, the leg base forms the letter Y, giving the collection its name. The dynamic edge on one side of the tabletop allows the coffee tables to sit neatly along a wall or next to another piece of furniture. Designed by Alexander Gufler.

item.g:title: Bloom central Table 271: Let Your Room Bloom
item.g:description: Arik Levy designed this table with its unique, flower-like wooden pedestal – a completely unconventional idea that will instantly catch your eye. Levy used four pieces of wood that branch outwards, like a flower in bloom. This table is a good match for the Split collection, as it is designed on a similar principle.

item.g:title: Logs Coat Stand: Sustainable Star
item.g:description: Made from wood offcuts that are no longer suitable for making chairs. We decided not to throw them away, but instead made a new sustainable product – a wall hook. Designed by German studio Büro famos, Logs is our sustainable star.

item.g:title: Again Chair: Bold Yet Stackable
item.g:description: A blend of traditional solid wood and bentwood, comfortable armrests and stackability makes this chair extraordinary. Designed by Alex Gufler, the unique rounded shape was inspired by a tennis racket. It will catch your eye again and again.

item.g:title: Again Chair: Bold Yet Stackable
item.g:description: A blend of traditional solid wood and bentwood, comfortable armrests and stackability makes this chair extraordinary. Designed by Alex Gufler, the unique rounded shape was inspired by a tennis racket. It will catch your eye again and again.

item.g:title: Again Barstool: Bold and Tall
item.g:description: Mixing traditional wood, bending, solid wood, comfortable armrests, and backrests makes this barstool out of the ordinary. Its unique rounded shape catches your eyes again and again. This tennis rocket-inspired design was created by Alexander Gufler.

item.g:description: The original woodgrain, clean lines, attention to detail and functionality. The Malmö table combines all the elements of Scandinavian design and is a great companion for chairs of all kinds, including armchairs. Designed by Michal Riabič.

They have created an elegant piece that references our traditional typology: a bentwood part that is usually combined with a cane weave for an extremely comfortable sitting experience.

item.g:description: The severe lines of this simple armchair, designed by Scandinavian designer Mads K. Johansen, give it an interesting appearance. Despite the severity of its shape, the Stockholm chair is an unobtrusive and comfortable seat, with substantial armrests providing the final touch.

item.g:title: Bergamo Armchair: Stackable Simplicity
item.g:description: This simple, angular lounge chair, designed by Tom Kelley, is often seen in hotels and offices, where it is valued for providing a comfortable seat with armrests and a curved backrest. The simple design of the Bergamo lounge chair is an advantage when choosing one of the many upholstery options.

item.g:description: This simple, angular lounge chair, designed by Tom Kelley, is often seen in hotels and offices, where it is valued for providing a comfortable seat with armrests and a curved backrest. item.g:title: Treviso Armchair: Italian Stackability
item.g:description: The stackable, comfortable Treviso armchair’s conservative look is unobtrusive, but will still catch your eye. Designed by Tom Kelley, the Treviso’s function follows its form, yet the chair is still imbued with Italian sparkle. The gently bent legs will fit into any interior, as will the numerous upholstery options.

item.g:title: 4 Armchair: Lean On The Heart
item.g:description: The armchair in our portfolio requiring the highest degree of craft and skill is the 4, due to the bent heart-shaped detail in the backrest, which necessitates a great deal of fine handwork. This model's legs, of lightly bent beechwood, are even more eye-catching in the version with armrests.

item.g:description: Simple bentwood shapes make any interior shine, be it hotel, restaurant or development project. If you need an unobtrusive, tried-and-tested design, reach for the Number 14 barstool – and let the surrounding interior do the talking.

item.g:title: Moritz Armchair: Comfort Squared
item.g:description: The Moritz chair, designed by Austrian Kai Stania, is inspired by the St Moritz resort in Switzerland. It combines a conservative square shape with comfort, wrapped up in a luxurious appearance. The comfort is boosted by pocket springs and injected foam, allowing you to concentrate on other pleasures in life: eating, loving or relaxing.

item.g:title: Merano Lounge Armchair: Modern Classic
item.g:description: Sit in this chair and set your responsibilities, and even time, aside. The precision-turned upholstery makes this chair a masterpiece that can also easily be combined with the other Merano family models, all designed by Alexander Gufler. As a result, a modern, comfortable restaurant or office can be equipped with different types of seating.

item.g:title: Casablanca Table 681: Cubist Companion
item.g:description: This low cubist coffee table is a member of the Casablanca family, designed by Tom Kelley. Its minimalist appearance makes it suitable for a wide range of interiors. It can be combined with the Casablanca armchair or two-seater, which will create an airy space with cubist regularity – a great advantage!

item.g:title: Chop Table: Adaptable Companion
item.g:description: This table, designed by Michal Riabič, is extendable to suit all your needs. An ingenious concealed mechanism allows the table to be extended by up to 240 cm, ensuring comfortable dining for up to ten people. The unusual appearance of the solid wood tabletop will also impress you – its individual planks are chopped and arranged widthwise.

item.g:title: Stand by 20 Coat Stand: Bentwood Beauty
item.g:description: Several types of bends come together in this typically Thonet coat-stand. A universal piece in our collection, it perfectly complements a wide variety of interiors. We use some of our smallest components when we make it.

item.g:title: 314 Chair: Dressed for future
item.g:description: Contemporary version of the legendary Chair 14 by Swedish design maestros Claesson Koivisto Rune. The lightweight combination of wood and mesh not only pays homage to traditional bentwood craftsmanship but also bridges the gap to the future with the innovative use of mesh, a material commonly found in sneakers. This fusion enables the design to speak in an unobtrusive and contemporary way.

item.g:title: 822 barstool: A touch of Scandinavia
item.g:description: This playful barstool comes in a wide range of colours that contrast well with the minimalist shapes designed by the Swedish design studio Claesson Koivisto Rune. With a backrest and armrests (or upholstery), this is the perfect addition to design space and increases comfort when sitting with a drink in hand.
